meanings.definition: A whorl or rosette of bracts beneath a flower or flower cluster.
meanings.sent1: The involucres of the sunflower protect the developing seeds.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the colorful involucres surrounding the daisy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the involucres as tiny hats for the garden gnomes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the blooming of the involucres, spreading joy all around.
meanings.sent5: As the wind rustled through the involucres, it sounded like a gentle whisper.
